control.controller

Class WindowResizer

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.event.MouseAdapter
      • control.controller.MouseMovementAdapter
        • control.controller.WindowResizer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.awt.event.MouseWheelListener, java.util.EventListener, javax.swing.SwingConstants

    public final class WindowResizer
extends MouseMovementAdapter
implements javax.swing.SwingConstants
    The WindowResizer is used to resize the window when the user grab the edges of the window it can't be instanced, so only WINDOW_RESIZER is usable
    Author:
    Daphnis

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int BORDER_WIDTH
      The width of the border allowing the user to resize the window, default is 5
      private javax.swing.JFrame frame
      The frame that the WindowResizer will handle and resize according to the events dispensed
      private boolean fullScreen
      Tell whether the frame is in full screen mode or not
      private int prevX
      Last known X location of the mouse
      private int prevY
      Last known Y location of the mouse
      private static javax.swing.border.LineBorder RESIZE_BORDER
      The border that will be set on the Window, the color is transparent so it looks like the mouse is not in the window
      private int resizeSide
      The side the user picked to resize the window
      private boolean resizing
      Tell if the user is currently resizing the window
      static WindowResizer WINDOW_RESIZER
      The only usable WindowResizer

      • Fields inherited from class control.controller.MouseMovementAdapter

        MAIN_FRAME

      • Fields inherited from interface javax.swing.SwingConstants

        BOTTOM, CENTER, EAST, HORIZONTAL, LEADING, LEFT, NEXT, NORTH, NORTH_EAST, NORTH_WEST, PREVIOUS, RIGHT, SOUTH, SOUTH_EAST, SOUTH_WEST, TOP, TRAILING, VERTICAL, WEST

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      private WindowResizer()
      Private constructor to restrict the number of WindowResizer to WINDOW_RESIZER

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private java.awt.Cursor getCursor()
      Get the Cursor appearance according to the resizeSide choosen
      void onMouseDragged(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
      Resize the window according to the movement of the mouse and the resizeSide selected If the resize request is bigger than the maximum size or smaller than the minimum size the window won't be resized
      void onMouseMoved(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
      Change the cursor appearance according to the location of the mouse
      void onMousePressed(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
      If the mouse is pressed and the window is not in full screen, the resizing boolean is set to true to indicate that the window can be resized
      void onMouseReleased(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
      Set the resizing boolean to false The left button needs to be pressed to resize the window Reset the cursor appearance by invoking onMouseMoved(java.awt.event.MouseEvent)
      void register(javax.swing.JFrame frame)
      Register the window to handle to the WindowResizer Can only be set once
      void toggleFullScreen()
      Toggle full screen mode so the window cannot be resized when in full screen works in pair with TitleBarAdapter If the frame is not null, switching to full screen will remove the border to make the window bigger switching back to window state will re set the border

      • Methods inherited from class control.controller.MouseMovementAdapter

        mouseClicked, mouseDragged, mouseEntered, mouseExited, mouseMoved, mousePressed, mouseReleased, mouseWheelMoved, onMouseClicked, onMouseEntered, onMouseExited, onMouseWheelMoved, setMAIN_FRAME

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

        The only usable WindowResizer

        public static final int BORDER_WIDTH
        The width of the border allowing the user to resize the window, default is 5

        Constant Field Values

      • RESIZE_BORDER

        private static final javax.swing.border.LineBorder RESIZE_BORDER
        The border that will be set on the Window, the color is transparent so it looks like the mouse is not in the window

    • Method Detail

      • register

        public void register(javax.swing.JFrame frame)
              throws java.lang.Exception
        Register the window to handle to the WindowResizer Can only be set once
        Parameters:
        frame - the frame to handle
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the WindowResizer already handle a frame

      • toggleFullScreen

        public void toggleFullScreen()
        Toggle full screen mode so the window cannot be resized when in full screen works in pair with TitleBarAdapter If the frame is not null, switching to full screen will remove the border to make the window bigger switching back to window state will re set the border

      • onMousePressed

        public void onMousePressed(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
        If the mouse is pressed and the window is not in full screen, the resizing boolean is set to true to indicate that the window can be resized
        Overrides:
        onMousePressed in class MouseMovementAdapter
        Parameters:
        e - the mouse event

      • onMouseMoved

        public void onMouseMoved(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
        Change the cursor appearance according to the location of the mouse
        Overrides:
        onMouseMoved in class MouseMovementAdapter
        Parameters:
        e - the mouse event

      • onMouseDragged

        public void onMouseDragged(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
        Resize the window according to the movement of the mouse and the resizeSide selected If the resize request is bigger than the maximum size or smaller than the minimum size the window won't be resized
        Overrides:
        onMouseDragged in class MouseMovementAdapter
        Parameters:
        e - the mouse event

      • onMouseReleased

        public void onMouseReleased(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
        Set the resizing boolean to false The left button needs to be pressed to resize the window Reset the cursor appearance by invoking onMouseMoved(java.awt.event.MouseEvent)
        Overrides:
        onMouseReleased in class MouseMovementAdapter
        Parameters:
        e - the mouse event

      • getCursor

        private java.awt.Cursor getCursor()
        Get the Cursor appearance according to the resizeSide choosen
        Returns:
        the new cursor
